briefTitle: Postoperative Analgesia Impact of Narcotic Free Anesthesia
officialTitle: The Impact on Postoperative Pain of Substituting Opioids by Beta Blockers for Peroperative Hemodynamic Control in Patients Undergoing Mastectomy
conditions: Pain, Postoperative, Breast Cancer, Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Postoperative consumption of narcotic in recovery room
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Woman
* 18 to 65 years old
* ASA 1 or 2
* First breast surgery
* Unilateral breast cancer
* Partial mastectomy or radical modified mastectomy ± axillary dissection

Exclusion Criteria:

* Allergy or contrindication to any medication figuring in the protocol or to Aspirin
* Patient taking betablocking drug drug or lanoxin or calcic channels blocking drug
* Narcotic consumption in the past month of 10 mg/day of morphine equivalent
* Chronic pain
* Moderate to severe asthma
* BMI of more than 40
* Diabetes
* Chronic renal or hepatic faiure
* Heart failure
* Anticipated difficult airway
* High grade heart block or bifascicular block
* Mental retardation
